Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 85c187e9a14110d8a7a1745990a4acc817a8ac3c
Adding meta-nuvoton OWNERS.

Hi Dhananjay,
Could you please kindly help to review this commit for setup npcm845 build environment?
If there is any suggestion, please let me know. Thank you.

Sincerely,
Tim

This evb layer setup is fine, but the build for evb-npcm845 doesn't work with this PR. Either some additional files/settings are missing or there needs to be some clean-up in meta-nuvoton/conf/machine/evb-npcm845.conf.

e.g. "packagegroup-evb-npcm845-apps" is unresolved.

Can you pull these additional files so that this PR will compile?

Further to this, the kernel definition is incomplete:

ERROR: linux-nuvoton-5.15.61+gitAUTOINC+03008ae8e1-r0 do_kernel_metadata: Could not locate BSP definition for nuvoton/standard and no defconfig was provided

> Further to this, the kernel definition is incomplete:
> 
> ERROR: linux-nuvoton-5.15.61+gitAUTOINC+03008ae8e1-r0 do_kernel_metadata: Could not locate BSP definition for nuvoton/standard and no defconfig was provided


Yes, I ran into same build error while trying clean-up the conf to make it compile without extra package groups etc.

It would be best to post other PRs to bring all missing conf/recipes from Nuvoton's repo and link this one OR combine into this PR itself.

Thanks Joel and Dhananjay both of your help to review this commit. Sorry for reply so late. I would like to adopt Dhananjay's suggestion to post other PRs to bring all missing conf/recipes from Nuvoton's repo and mark this PR as dependent on them.

Hi Joel, Dhananjay,

Since we cannot find nuvoton dts and related drivers be merged in dev-5.15 of openbmc/linux. Thus, we changed to use dev-6.0 and Arbel EVB can boot into openbmc prompt shell as below for you refer it. Could you please help to review and merge this commit then we can start submit the other PR for Arbel EVB? Thank you.

Linux version 6.0.2-b380fe3-dirty-4c34e0f (oe-user@oe-host) (aarch64-openbmc-linux-gcc (GCC) 12.2.0, GNU ld (GNU Binutils) 2.39.0.20220819) #1 SMP PREEMPT Mon Oct 17 07:24:51 UTC 2022
Machine model: Nuvoton npcm845 Development Board (Device Tree)
earlycon: uart8250 at MMIO32 0x00000000f0000000 (options '')
printk: bootconsole [uart8250] enabled
....
...
evb-npcm845 login: root
Password:
root@evb-npcm845:~#

Dear Joel,

Due to patch files are not allow according policy in run-repotest.
Could you help us to merged those pathes for nuvoton arbel support in dev-6.0 openbmc/linux? Then we can remove those patche files in this commit.

Best regards,
Tim

Hi Joel,
Could you kindly help us to review this commit for kernel part?
We really need your help. Thank you.

Sincerely,
Tim

The kernel part can come in with this change, which you can base your patch on:

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openbmc/+/57967

Tomer has reservations about moving to dev-6.0. Due to a lack of mainline Linux support for the npcm7xx, the v6.0 kernel lacks full support for that generation of parts. We need someone who requires support for those parts to progress the mainline submission of the required kernel patches before we can move forward.

Hi Joel,
Thanks your feedback.
Those 13 patches in this commit that I already base on #57967 dev-6.0

KBRANCH ?= "dev-6.0"
LINUX_VERSION ?= "6.0.2"
SRCREV="b380fe3037afd47726ab84684df5ee620793bb25"

I want to confirm with you again that you means those 13 patches need to be submit to openbmc/linux then I can remove those patches and just update SRCREV in meta-nuvoton/recipes-kernel/linux/linux-nuvoton_git.bb after #57967 commit be merged, right?

Hi Tim,

As Joel said, 

I prefer we stay in kernel 5.15 until we will add the necessary Nuvoton drivers to kernel 6.0.

Thanks,

Tomer

Hi Tim,

As Joel said, 

I prefer we stay in kernel 5.15 until we will add the necessary Nuvoton drivers to kernel 6.0.

Thanks,

Tomer

Hi Tomer,
I have changed to kernel 5.15, please help to review it and if there is any I misunderstand just let me know.
Thanks your review and suggestion.

Sincerely,
Tim

Hi All,
Could you help to review and merge for this meta-evb-npcm845 layer?
Thanks for all your help on it.

Sincerely,
Tim
Please split out the generic meta-nuvoton defconfig change from the EVB change
Thanks your review. We have split it out from EVB change.

Dear Benjamin,
We have split out and remove meta-nuvoton related it.
Could you please help us review it again? Thank you so much.

Best regards,
Tim

Dear Benjamin,
Is there any suggestion for arbel evb layer?
Could you kindly help to review it? Thank you, just friendly ping.

Best regards,
Tim
Looks good to me. Someone from OWNERS needs to +2 for it to be merged though

Hi Patrick and Dhananjay,
Could you help us to review this commit? Thank you.

Best regards,
Tim

Hi Benjamin,
Friendly ping about this commit in case gerrit didn't inform you it again. Thank you.

Best regards,
Tim

I'm not able to approve this change. Someone from the OWNERS file will need to instead.

You can try pinging them on Discord
Ideally some of these hardware requirements should find their way into a meta-nuvoton file or meta-phosphor file, I think?  We don't want to have to duplicate these everywhere.
Thanks your suggestion. We will try to find the way and prevent to duplicate these hardware requirement repos. Thank you.
